triples.name: Control Theory
triples.relevance: Provides the mathematical and theoretical foundation for the tracking control approach applied to UAV systems.

triples.name: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the application domain and physical systems being controlled in the proposed consensus tracking control scheme.

triples.name: Consensus Dynamics
triples.relevance: Consensus tracking mechanisms are adapted and applied to enable multiple UAVs to coordinate their flight trajectories cooperatively.

triples.name: Fuzzy Control System
triples.relevance: An adaptive fuzzy fault compensation mechanism is introduced to ensure flight safety when UAV motors fault in harsh environments.

triples.name: Human-in-the-Loop
triples.relevance: A novel hybrid approach is proposed where humans make critical decisions alongside autonomous UAV control systems during complex flight missions.

triples.name: Fault Tolerance
triples.relevance: Fault tolerance mechanisms are addressed through the adaptive fuzzy compensation approach to handle motor faults during harsh environment operations.

triples.name: Multi-Agent System
triples.relevance: Multiple cooperating UAVs form a multi-agent system where consensus tracking control coordinates their collective behavior.

triples.name: Tracking Error
triples.relevance: The paper addresses tracking error with a key requirement that the error sign cannot change during consensus tracking missions.
